result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on December 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

0:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio D. Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Antonio D. Johnson. Officer Colin Hirsch of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio D. Johnson appeared by phone.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Antonio D. Johnson. Preliminary Hearing scheduled by zoom. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court states attorney Freeman is prohibited from practicing law at this time. Defendant to contact public defenders office for reappointment of counsel. Bond to continue.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:10 PM Defendant Antonio D. Johnson in court by video in custody with attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan and Margaret Ginocchio  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim T.L.J., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of any weapons. Not to make threats towards anyone.  Must remain at residence between the hours of 7pm and 7am unless at work or going to and from work.
